The Extraordinary Journey of The Fakir, directed by Marjane Satrapi , also has Uma Thurman in the cast

Actor Dhanush says he is “excited” about his Hollywood debut with Iranian-French director Marjane Satrapi’s The Extraordinary Journey Of the Fakir Who Got Trapped In The Ikea Cupboard .

“I am very excited by this opportunity to work in a full length Hollywood film,” he said in a statement here on Monday.

Stellar cast

In the movie, the 32-year-old will share screen space with Uma Thurman, Captain Phillips actor Barkhad Abdi, Laurent Lafitte and The Bandit Queen actor Seema Biswas.

“The director, Marjane Satrapi, felt I would be apt for this role and I feel there are many facets I can explore for this character,” the national award-winning actor said, thanking his fans for “pushing me to explore new endeavours and challenges all the time.”

Based on French novel

Based on Romain Puertolas’ bestselling debut novel of the same name, the comedy adventure movie follows a wild storyteller from New Delhi who falls in love with a woman when he reaches Paris, but accidentally gets deported along with a group of African refugees.

The novel, which came out in 2014, has been translated into 35 languages. It tells the pilgrimage of a con man from India to an IKEA in Paris which turns into a philosophical odyssey. — PTI
title: Dhanush excited to star alongside Uma Thurman
